text_blocks.text: THE ORGANIZATION AND FUNCTIONING OF THE NATIONAL COMMITTEE FOR DISASTER MANAGEMENT

Preahkaruna Preah Bat Samdech Boramniet NORODOM SIHAMONI Samanphum Cheatsasna Rakhatkhateya Khemrarothreas Puthinthreathoreamohaksat Khemareachnea Samohorpheas Kampuchak Eakreachroath Boranaksante Sopheakmonglea Sereivibolea Khemarasreypireas Preah Chao Krong Kampuchea Thipdey

This Royal Decree defines the organization and functioning of the National Committee for Disaster Management hereafter referred to as “NCDM”, as the headquarters of the Royal Government to lead, administer and coordinate all disaster management activities induced by either natural or human-made disasters in the Kingdom of Cambodia.
The NCDM consists of the following members:

The NCDM consists of the following members:
* Prime Minister of the Kingdom of Cambodia President
* Minister of Interior       Vice President
* Minister in Charge of the Office of the Council Ministers Vice President
* Minister of National Defense        Vice President
* Minister of National Assembly-Senate Relations and Inspections Vice President
* Minister of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation  Vice President
* One High Dignitary       Permanent Vice President
* One High Dignitary         Vice President
* One Dignitary          Vice President
* Minister of Economy and Finance Member
* Minister of Planning         Member
* Minister of Water Resources and Meteorology    Member
* Minister of Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries     Member
* Minister of Environment        Member
* Minister of Commerce         Member
* Minister of Land Management, Urban Planning and Construction Member
* Minister of Mines and Energy Member
* Minister of Industry and Handicraft      Member
* Minister of Tourism         Member
* Minister of Health         Member
* Minister of Information        Member
* Minister of Education, Youth and Sports Member
* Minister of Public Works and Transport Member
* Minister of Rural Development       Member
* Minister of Womenâs Affairs        Member
* Minister of Labor and Vocational Training Member
The actual composition of the NCDM shall be designated by a resolution of the Royal Government.
CHAPTER 3 TASKS AND RESPONSIBILITIES OF THE NCDM
The NCDM has the following tasks and responsibilities:
The NCDM shall convene a meeting at least once a year upon the invitation of the President. The President could delegate the task to a Permanent Vice President as deemed necessary.

NCDM could invite the representatives of ministries, institutions, public sector, private sector, development partners, and civil society to participate in the consultation meeting and conduct the research on every issue associated with the disaster management framework.
The NCDM consists of an executive committee with the following components:

The NCDM consists of an executive committee with the following components:
* Permanent Vice President of NCDM Chair
* Two Vice Presidents of NCDM Vice Chairs
* Secretary-General of NCDM        Member
The actual composition of NCDM’s executive committee shall be designated by a resolution of the Royal Government.
The NCDM shall acquire a number of technical advisors and experts as deemed necessary.

The NCDM shall have a Secretariat-General for the day-to-day operations. The Secretariat‐General of the NCDM shall be administered by a Secretary-General and a number of Deputy Secretary-Generals who shall be nominated by a Royal Decree or Sub-Degree.
The organizing and functioning of the Secretariat-General of the NCDM shall be determined by a Sub-Decree.
The NCDM has the right to use its separate logo and seal.
The expenditure for the functioning of the NCDM shall be allocated by the national budget in the budget plan of the Office of the Council of Ministers.
The NCDM shall have the privilege to receive and utilize funds obtained from other sources for executing its tasks in compliance with the effective legal procedures.

The Government Officials who have been appointed prior to the entry into force of this Royal Decree shall maintain their titles and privileges until the newly reappointed Government Officials in accordance with the provisions of this Royal Decree.
Any provision which is contrary to this Royal Decree shall be considered as annulled.
Samdech Akka Moha Sena Padei Techo HUN SEN, Prime Minister of the Kingdom of Cambodia shall be responsible to implement this Royal Decree from the date of signature onward.

document_description:
This Royal Decree defines the organisation and functioning of the National Committee for Disaster Management (NCDM), as the headquarters of the Royal Government to lead, administer and coordinate all disaster management activities induced by either natural or human-made disasters in the Kingdom of Cambodia. 

The NCDM has the following tasks and responsibilities: 
1) Issue the policies, strategic plans, plans of action, regulations, programmes and projects for disaster management; 2)Issue guidelines for implementation of disaster management, promote public awareness, prevention, mitigation, preparedness, emergency response and recovery for safety and resilience; 3)Recommend the Royal Government to take action on every case that will cause disaster and disaster occurrence; 4)Coordinate the implementation of disaster risk reduction, mainstreaming of climate change, sustainable development, and gender issues by collaboration with line ministries in developing and strengthening the institutions, mechanisms and disaster management at all levels, in particular, at local community level to ensure better response during emergencies; 5)Mobilize resources for implementation of policies, strategic plans, plans of action, relevant programmes and projects of disaster risk reduction; 6)Strengthen collaboration and cooperation with development partners, public sector, private sector and civil society for the benefits of disaster reduction; 7)Strengthen and expand collaboration at the regional and international levels in disaster reduction; 8)Manage the information and communication associated with disaster risk reduction activities; 9)Raise proposal to the Royal Government on the requirement, reserve, budget, resource and assistance for emergency response and recovery; 10)Implement other tasks assigned by the Royal Government.
